p: A virus is a small infectious organism that must invade a living cell to reproduce. Some viruses, such as hepatitis B and hepatitis C, can cause chronic infections that could last for years ( Kramer et al., 2008). In the last decade, the influenza virus (A:H1N1pdm09) has drawn attention by the pandemic that provoked morbidity and mortality ( WHO, 2010). More recently, the outbreak of the novel coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2), that has affected more than 9 million patients all over the world, has become a major global health concern ( WHO, 2020), and efforts must be done in order to prevent the virus spread.
